definitions.definition: To bring up to maturity, as offspring; to educate; to instruct; to foster.
(said of people towards animals) To breed and raise.
definitions.example: The family has been rearing cattle for 200 years.

definitions.definition: To rise up on the hind legs
definitions.example: The horse was shocked, and thus reared.

definitions.definition: To rise high above, tower above.
To raise physically or metaphorically; to lift up; to cause to rise, to elevate.
definitions.example: The monster slowly reared its head.

definitions.definition: To construct by building; to set up
To raise spiritually; to lift up; to elevate morally.
(regional, obsolete) To revive, bring to life, quicken. (only in the phrase, to rear to life)
definitions.example: He healeth the blind and he reareth to life the dead.

definitions.definition: To place in the rear; to secure the rear of.
